results.title: Elephant theatre
results.brief_description: Like an Indian pod filled with tiny ivory elephants, the imaginary hand-size theatre fills with elephants, to the delight of the man who built it.

results.title: Dust (On Wheels )
results.brief_description:
Two groups of teenagers - a white brother and sister, and two Aboriginal mates - come together to find work on a dusty cotton field in the outback. What they discover hidden in the ground, is history itself. Switching effortlessly from the naturalism of the relationships between the youth to the grandeur of the mythic power and terror of the resolution, this short film is an exemplary example of contemporary Australian cinema.
Mick is young, white and angry at the world. His sister Amy is trying to keep it all together, not an easy task when Mick seems determined to screw things up. Leroy is afraid his future holds nothing beyond this life in the mirage of a dusty field. His best mate Vance works alongside him, more interested in Amy than chipping weeds. Ruby, Leroy’s mother is the only one who notices when the uneasy sky forces the elements to merge. As a violent dust storm awakes, racial differences must be put aside as the five shelter in Leroy’s car. Australia’s history, black and white, is revealed as the storm unearths the secrets that lie beneath the surface of the land.

results.title: The Drover's wife
results.brief_description: From Henry Lawson via Russell Drysdale - The Australian myth of The Drover’s Wife retold from a different perspective. Story retold by Murray Bail. Based on Henry Lawson’s original story and inspired by Drysdale’s painting of the same name this film explores women’s invisibility in our cultural history. What is so wonderful about this program is not only that it uses a wide variey of commentators and visual and literay sources, but it is positive and free of professional jargon. Cast features Martin Vaughan. Won Silver Award and Special Award for Acting in the General Category at the AFI Awards.

results.title: The Drive home
results.brief_description: Everyone wants to know how to find their perfect partner. A woman is driving home, listening to her car radio when the DJ announces a new theory on how to find your perfect partner. Only trouble is, the woman’s car is about to enter a tunnel. Will she ever discover the secret?

results.title: A Personal search
results.brief_description: In this autobiographical documentary, John Whitney, one of the best-known film and computer artists of our time, reflects on and explores his lifelong search for the complentarity of music and visual art, and the synthesis of film and computer technologies. In doing so, he describes current developments that foretell radical and exciting new ways viewers will soon be experiencing music and art.

results.title: Permutations
results.brief_description:
An early example of computer generated animation; several hundred dots move about the screen according to a set of
instructions in a graphics program which were input into a
IBM digital computer and coloured by an optical printer.
‘Action sequences, proceeding from order to disorder and back to ordered patterning, suggest a parallel to harmonic phenomena of the musical scale … The effect is to subtly generate and resolve tension - which is similar to the primary emotional power of music composition’ (John Whitney).

results.title: Matrix
results.brief_description: Another of John Whitney’s important investigations into technology and the moving image, this particularly geometric animated abstraction uses industrial computers to render Whitney’s light musical forms onto the screen. Computer generated forms evolve, merge and subdivide on a black background, each motion and movement as carefully orchestrated and synthesised as the accompanying music.

results.title: Experiments in motion graphics
results.material_description: Single channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: In this documentary film exploring his working processes, John Whitney explains some of the techniques and philosophies involved in programming and animating his computer-made abstract films. He attempts to define his new art of ‘motion graphics’ by comparison with music and language. As well as an intriguing investigation into his work, this film is a visual feast of his remarkable dynamic abstractions.

results.title: Prayers of a mother
results.material_description: Multi channel moving image, colour and audio
results.brief_description: A video installation that centres around a mother’s prayers for her children. Her hopes and concern for her family are expressed through edited sequences of her children’s faces contrasted by a single image of her hands holding a prayer book and rosary.
results.description: A video installation that centres around a mother’s prayers for her children. Her hopes and concern for her family are expressed through edited sequences of her children’s faces contrasted by a single image of her hands holding a prayer book and rosary.
